meanings.definition: To lie exposed to warmth and light, typically from the sun
meanings.sent1: The cat basks in the sun on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: The lizard basks on the rock to warm up its body.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy dog basks lazily in the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The flower basks in the gentle rays, soaking up the sun's energy.
meanings.sent5: The turtle basks peacefully, enjoying the sun's soothing warmth.

meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or satisfaction in something
meanings.sent1: She basks in the praise she receives for her artwork.
meanings.sent2: He basks in the joy of spending time with his family.
meanings.sent3: The child basks in the happiness of playing with friends.
meanings.sent4: The team basks in the glory of their hard-earned victory.
meanings.sent5: The musician basks in the applause of the audience after a performance.
